com.oracle.tools.deferred
Class DeferredHelper

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.deferred.DeferredHelper

public class DeferredHelper
extends Object

The DeferredHelper defines a collection of static helper methods for working with Deferreds.

Copyright (c) 2012. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

ensure

public static <T> T ensure(T value)
Obtains the value of a value (this is the identity function for non-deferred).

This method is provided for API symmetry.

Parameters:
value - the value
Returns:
the value

ensure

public static <T> T ensure(Deferred<T> deferred)
Obtains the value of a Deferred.

This is functionally equivalent to calling Deferred.get() on ensured(Deferred).

Parameters:
deferred - the Deferred to ensure
Returns:
the value of the Deferred

                           long totalRetryDuration,

totalRetryDurationUnits - the TimeUnits for the duration

future

public static <T> Deferred<T> future(Class<T> clzOfResult,
                                     Future<T> future)
Obtains a Deferred representation of a Java Future.

Parameters:
clzOfResult - the Class of result from the Future
future - the Future
Returns:
a Deferred

invoking

public static <T> T invoking(T object)
Creates a dynamic proxy of an Object. The returned proxy will record interactions (method calls) against the proxy for the purposes of representing the calls as Deferreds.

The results of interactions on the returned proxy are always non-sense and/or other dynamic proxies. To determine the actual result (as a Deferred), one must call eventually(Object).

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Object
Parameters:
object - the Object to proxy
Returns:
a recording dynamic proxy of the Object

invoking

public static <T> T invoking(Deferred<T> deferred)
Creates a dynamic proxy of a Deferred object. The returned proxy will record interactions (method calls) against the proxy for the purposes of representing the calls as Deferreds.

The results of interactions on the returned proxy are always non-sense and/or other dynamic proxies. To determine the actual result (as a Deferred), one must call eventually(Object).

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Object
Parameters:
deferred - the Deferred object to proxy
Returns:
a recording dynamic proxy of the Object

eventually

public static <T> Deferred<T> eventually(T t)
Obtains a Deferred representation of the last call to a dynamic proxy created with either invoking(Object) or invoking(Deferred).

Parameters:
t - the value returned from an call to 'invoking'
Returns:
a Deferred representation of a previous call invoking(Object)

eventually

public static <T> Deferred<T> eventually(Deferred<T> t)
Obtains a Deferred representation of the last call to a dynamic proxy created with either invoking(Object) or invoking(Deferred). If there was no call to create a dynamic proxy, the provided deferred is ensured and returned.

Parameters:
t - the deferred value (usually returned from 'invoking')
Returns:
a Deferred representation of a previous call invoking(Object)

eventually

public static <T> Deferred<T> eventually(T t,
                                         long totalRetryDuration,
                                         TimeUnit totalRetryDurationUnits)
Obtains a Deferred representation of the last call to a dynamic proxy created with either invoking(Object) or invoking(Deferred).

Parameters:
t - the value returned from an call to 'invoking'
totalRetryDuration - the maximum duration for retrying
totalRetryDurationUnits - the TimeUnits for the duration
Returns:
a Deferred representation of a previous call invoking(Object)

eventually

public static <T> Deferred<T> eventually(Deferred<T> t,
                                         long totalRetryDuration,
                                         TimeUnit totalRetryDurationUnits)
Obtains a Deferred representation of the last call to a dynamic proxy created with either invoking(Object) or invoking(Deferred). If there was no call to create a dynamic proxy, the provided deferred is ensured and returned.

Parameters:
t - the deferred value (usually returned from 'invoking'
totalRetryDuration - the maximum duration for retrying
totalRetryDurationUnits - the TimeUnits for the duration
Returns:
a Deferred representation of a previous call invoking(Object)
